8 shoulder stitches you need to have the same kind and amount of stitches so it has to be symmetric after the first 2 row you will have the following setup from the front 1k edge stitch 1k 1p 8k shoulder 1p 2k 1p 2k … 2k 1p 2k 1p back 8k shoulder 1p 1k 1k edge stitch with the next row start increasing for the v-neck after the 3 row increase in every 4 th row 1 stitches in the beginning and in the end of the row too with the increases take care when in your main pattern 2k 1p the following stitch is a purl stitch then you can make m1pr or m1pl instead of knit stitches ● rs row 3 ○ k1 ○ m1l v-neck increasing only in every 4 th row ○ work in pattern to the next sm ○ m1r sm ○ k8 stockinette stitch sm ○ m1l ○ work in pattern to the next sm ○ m1r sm ○ k8 with stockinette stitch sm ○ m1l ○ work in pattern to the last stitch ○ m1r v-neck increase only in every 4 th row ○ k1 ● ws row 4 ○ work in pattern to the next sm m1l ○ p8 stockinette stitch sm ○ m1r ○ work in pattern to the next sm ○ m1l sm ○ p8 with stockinette stitch sm ○ m1r ○ work with pattern to the end you increased 4+2 stitches 2 for the neckline now you have 69 72 72 75 75 78 stitches on your needle repeat row 3 and row 4 6 7 7 8 8 9 times more do not forget the v-neck increasing in every 4 th row after the 1 section you will have 123 134 134 147 147 158 stitches on your needle tip you can count the row or make some notes in the following table rs ws rs lolbert-szabó júlia ©copyright 2024 instagram @lsz_juli this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way 4 ws 2 section ● rs row 1 ○ k to the next sm with the main pattern and sm m1pl ○ knitting with the main pattern k2 p1 k2 p1 k2 to the next sm ○ m1pr
